text: Aaron Lord (born 21 July 1975) is a former professional Australian rules footballer who played for Geelong and Hawthorn in the AFL. A forward pocket specialist, Lord made his league debut in 1994 with Geelong. After three seasons with the Cats he moved to Hawthorn where he enjoyed his most prolific time up forward. He kicked a bag of 6 goals five times in his career and his best season tally came in 1999 when he topped Hawthorn's goalkicking with 42 goals. In 2002 he returned to Geelong at pick one in the pre-season draft before retiring at the end of the following season. In 2004 Aaron was part of a reality TV show The Resort. The show had 15 young people renovating a holiday resort in Fiji. The show was a ratings disaster and Aaron admitted to being a little scarred from the whole reality TV experience..http://www.realityravings.com/2009/12/02/where-are-they-now-from- reality-shows-long-forgotten He later found employment with the sports attache at the Australian Embassy in Paris and late as a senior adviser to the Victorian sports minister.
